result.execSummary:
The defendant Bryon E. Childers was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain full time employment/30 hours/week or apply for at least 5 jobs/week qualified for.

DNA Sample.
Completion of AODA and treatment follow with recommendation discretion of agent.
Maintain Absolute Sobriety. 
No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license. 
Participate in counseling as deemed beneficial agent.

timeConds.notes:
Huber Privileges.
Report within 60 days to serve jail.
May be served in Langlade, Lincoln or Oneida County.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bryon E. Childers

records.addlTxt: 11:01 AM Defendant Bryon E. Childers in court.  Attorney Kelly L Hays in court for State of Wisconsin. State gives agreement, plea to charge, withheld sentence 1 year probation, costs, AODA and treatment, Maintain Absolute Sobriety. No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license. Maintain full time employment 30 hours/week or apply for at least 5 jobs/week qualified for and counseling deemed by agent and argue 15 days conditional time.  Def. would like time served. State heard on credit. Court explains how credit time works.  Def. agrees with plea agreement.  Waiver of right to attorney form gone over with def. Def. makes statement.  Court finds waiver is freely & voluntarily given and finds def. may represent himself and finds def. is competent. Plea questionnaire and waiver of rights gone over with def. Def advised of charges and penalties.  Ct 1 D.C., repeater, no contest plea. Def. advised of constitutional rights & J.T. rights.  Def. understands elements. Def. admits prior conviction. Def. advised of possible deportation if not US Citizen. Def. questions repeater, Court explains.  Def. agrees with repeater.  Court finds plea is freely & voluntarily given.  Factual basis.  Court finds factual basis, accepts plea and finds def. Guilty to D.C. repeater. State ask court to adopt joint recommendation and gives sentencing remarks.  Def. makes statement. Court orders withheld sentence 1 year probation, costs, DNA Sample and $200 surcharge, Completion of AODA and treatment follow with recommendation direction of agent, Maintain Absolute Sobriety, No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license,  Maintain full time employment 30 hours/week or apply for at least 5 jobs/week qualified for, Participate counseling deemed beneficial by agent, & 48 hours jail, huber privileges, May be served within 60 days to report, May serve in Langlade, Lincoln or Oneida Co. State heard on credit. Credit for 10 days if revoked. Def, advised of postconviction rights.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Bond applied to costs and balance returned to poster. State complied with victim rights.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 11, 2022 at 11:00 am.

03:26 PM Defendant Bryon E. Childers in court, in custody.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bryon E. Childers appeared by video means.  Def. would like to represent himself today. Court explains.  Def. request signature bond. Court needs written notice for bail/bond hearing.  Def. will represent himself.  Court goes over waiver of attorney rights with def.  Court finds atty waiver is freely & voluntarily given.Court finds def. stands mute & court enters Not Guilty plea. Bond continues.  Status conference scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 11:00 am.

No contact with victim or alleged victim residence.
Maintain Absolute Sobriety.
No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license.

01:18 PM Defendant Bryon E. Childers in court, in custody.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bryon E. Childers appeared by video means. All parties via zoom.   Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given atty rights and given 3 options, PD, hire own or court appointed atty.  Def. wants to complete case today.  Defendant heard on matter. Def. will contact P.D. State gives bail/bond recommendation.  Def. is on probation hold. Def. makes statement. Court orders $750 cash bond with conditions.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
